Filth.text: An outside curve. A 'Pure Filth' is one that goes from wall to wall without touching.

Post.text: Diagonal throw to the corner without spin

Hop.text: Any inside curve. The most extreme are referred to as 'Hard Hop'

Wallride.text: Bouncing the disc along the wall

Short Hop.text: bouncing the disc off the wall you are standing next to.

Skimmer.text: Shot that barely bounces off the wall.

Tire.text: The super lob throw because the hammering motion of the arm or becaues it looks like a tire

Soft Serve.text: ICECREAM!!! any serve less than blue on speed that is not a lob. Typically said in the same manner as 'toasty' from early Mortal Kombat games

Lobster Fest.text: When 2 players lob back in forth trying to keep the other from getting or haveing juice.

Block Lobster.text: Blocking a disc only to let it drop to the ground because your lobster claws couldn't handle it

The Pull.text: First throw of a set. Fancy way of saying 'serve'

Knock Down Pass.text: 2v2 exclusive. Catching a disc that hit teammate in the back.

Ho Stack.text: Players playing the two sides instead of front back. Ho stands for horizontal

Vert Stack.text: Players playing with one player in front and one player in back. Vert stands for vertical

Run through.text: The act of continually blocking or continually sliding shots solely for your teammate to get the throw.

Blocker.text: A player that plays at the net.

Handler.text: A player that plays at the goal line.

Dump.text: The act of passing the disc back.

Swing.text: The act of passing cross court. usually used to catch out of position players.

Push.text: The act of passing the disc forward.

Block Pass.text: Act of blocking the disc and your teammate picking it up. A perfect block pass will result in a super for the player catching it.

Advantage.text: Term for when one team is at a point where the next disc will win the game for them.

Jam Point.text: When both players/teams are at 44 or above and the next Disc will win the game.

Pseudo.text: When both players/teams reach a rally that will cause either team to win the set based on its outcome

Mega Jam Point.text: Jam point on set 3 of final game in a match.

Hell.text: Any rally that extends past 20 points.

Hell and a Half.text: Any rally that extends past 30 points.

Double Hell.text: Any rally that extends past 40 points.

Full Destruction.text: Any rally that extends past 50 points.

Full jam.text: Jamming someone the first two sets in a row. Psuedo Full is just two sets in a row without being the first 2 in a game.

Point Cap.text: The amout of points at which a set is over. (50 in standard play)

Reading.text: How a player sees the initial angle and spin on the disc.

Trapping.text: Meeting the disc near a wall to get a block or catch.

Stuff Super.text: The act of standing slightly off the net and throwing into a stuff block as to get a super off the deflection.

Serving circle.text: The blue/red circle you serve from.

Center-dotting.text: The act of continually throwing the disc to your opponents serving circle. Mainly used to help train new players.

Reset.text: The act of throwing a lob to the back line after sliding allowing you more time to reset.

Slide Through.text: The act of sliding through a disc in order to gain a position closer to the net.

Step-In.text: The act of standing out of the Lob target til the disc is catchable and then steping in while pressing A for the perfect.

#ExcuseJam.text: When someone makes an excuse for losing a rally, set, or game. (NoJohns)

Booped.text: The act of getting hit in the back with the disc that causes your player to fall down.

JamFam.text: Name for players in the Disc Jam Community.
